author: T Karnakar Reddy
text:
As many as 38 Chenchu families, a particularly vulnerable tribal group , were freed from the clutches of bonded labour at Amaragiri village of Kollapur mandal in Mahabubnagar district on Thursday following a raid by Revenue Divisional Officer, Nagarkurnool.

NGOs National Adivasi Solidarity Council and India Justice Mission together brought the issue to the notice of District Collector, T.K. Sridevi, who asked RDO Devendhar Reddy to raid the village.
title: Chenchus freed from bonded labour
